p: The methods elaborated in the British Pharmacopoeia were used to prepare the simple ointment base. 21 Accordingly, after the hard paraffin (0.50g) was melted in a water bath, all the other ingredients (cetostearyl alcohol (0.50g), white soft paraffin (8.5 g), and wool fat (0.50g)) were added in their descending order of melting point. Then, the mixture was heated gently with stirring until being homogenous followed by cooling. Finally, the 5% and 10% (w/w) extract ointments were prepared by integrating 10 g and 20 g of the crude extract into a 200 g and 400 g of simple ointment base, respectively.
